str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To account or treat as worthy. From axios; to deem entitled or fit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A calling, invitation; in the NT, always of a divine call. From a shorter form of kaleo; an invitation.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From agathos; goodness, i.e. Virtue or beneficence.
From a presumed compound of eu and the base of dokeo; satisfaction, i.e. delight, or kindness, wish, purpose.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
